I just received the *Thanks, on its way to CRAN* email ðŸ“§ about the [tada](tada.tada.science) package ðŸŽ‰, so it's a good time for a celebration, and what better way to celebrate than with a dash of poetry.

The `@dev` version gains a `verse()` function to write poetry about R packages, thanks for the heavy lifting of the [mlverse/chattr](https://mlverse.github.io/chattr/) ðŸ“¦. We try to maintain a `@main` branch that could be released at any time, and `chattr` is not yet released. We hope it will be for the spring ðŸŒ¤ï¸ release of [tada](tada.tada.science), but it will be for the meantime available in the `@dev` branch.

So let's dive right in and do some [ggplot2](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org) poetry ðŸª¶

![](ggplot2.png){fig-align="center" width="692"}

For additional fun, we can write some poetry about a random package we discover with [tada::pkg_roulette()](https://tada.tada.science/reference/pkg_roulette.html)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tada::pkg_roulette() |> tada::verse()
```
:::
